header.title: Domain Analysis Model: Tuberculosis Surveillance, Diagnosis, Treatment and Research, Release 1

div2.head: Notes to Readers
div2.p: The National Institutes of Health has funded the Tuberculosis Project (supported by HHSN268200425214C) to develop a methodology for standardizing tuberculosis data collected in the healthcare process such that the data will support multiple secondary uses in the areas of research, surveillance, and quality improvement.
This project relies on the ANSI accreditation process espoused by Health Level Seven (HL7) and CDISC, both of which are standard data organizations engaged with this undertaking.

For 2 years, global stakeholders from industry, government agencies, and medical professional societies met regularly, participating in a consensus process to develop standard terminology and associated definitions called data elements. The next steps in the process was to obtain input from the community on the materials produced and then to ballot or register them as official standards. The final balloted version is for data elements representing diagnosis and treatment of pulmonary tuberculosis. Subsequent data elements will be added to this current list.
The data elements are in the TB Class and Activity Model document. The data elements in excel format are also in the Supporting Documents zip file labeled "Data Elements".
